Create a time capsule: Bake a loaf of bread and store it in a special container, marking the date on the outside. Bury it in the ground and set a reminder to unearth it after a certain period of time, such as a year or five years. This will give you a tangible reminder of your regrets and how far you've come since then.

Write a letter to your future self: Write a letter to your future self, expressing your regrets and the lessons you've learned since starting the assignment earlier. Include specific details about what you wish you had done differently and how it would have impacted your life.

Make a vision board: Create a vision board of what you hope to achieve in the future, including specific goals and milestones. Use images of successful people in your field or industry as inspiration. This will help you stay motivated and focused on your goals.

Create a gratitude journal: Start a gratitude journal and write down three things you're grateful for each day. This will help you focus on the positive aspects of your life and shift your mindset from regret to gratitude.

Take a class: Enroll in a class or workshop related to your assignment and start learning new skills. This will not only help you improve your performance, but also give you a sense of accomplishment and pride in your progress.
